alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 10:37PM CDT until August 28 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Williamson County in south central Texas... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1037 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Austin, Round Rock, Cedar Park, Anderson Mill, Leander and Brushy Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
